{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}}: a woman with breasts with nipples kneeling or standing. In modern form turned on left side. Compare {{och-l|女|woman}}, which has developed similarly, but does not include dots for nipples and has lost one breast in the modern form.

{{ja-readings
|goon=[[む]] (mu), [[も]] (mo)

|kanyoon=[[ぼ]] (bo)

}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-l|母語|ぼご|bogo}}: [[mother tongue]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|父母|ふぼ|fubo}}: both [[parents]]; one's [[father]] and [[mother]]
* {{ja-l|酵母|こうぼ|kōbo}}: [[yeast]]
* {{ja-l|教母|きょうぼ|kyōbo}}: a [[godmother]]

====Usage notes====
In isolation, the character {{lang|ja|母}} has 5 strokes in modern Japanese – it is not simplified. In {{l|ja|新字体|sc=Latn|shinjitai}} compound characters, such as {{ja-l|毎}} or {{ja-l|海}}, it is simplified to 4 strokes, as {{ja-l|毋}}, but this simplification is not used in isolation. In {{l|ja|表外字|sc=Latn|hyōgaiji}} characters such as {{ja-l|姆}}, however, the component is not simplified.

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|嚊}}, {{ja-l|嬶}}

===Etymology 1===
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はは}}. {{IPAchar|/haha/}}: {{IPAchar|*/papa/}} > {{IPAchar|/fafa/}} > {{IPAchar|/fawa/}} > {{IPAchar|/fafa/}} > {{IPAchar|/haha/}}

Medial {{IPAchar|/-f/ [ɸ]}} regularly changes to {{IPAchar|/w/ [ɰᵝ]}}, resulting in {{IPAchar|/fawa/}} > {{IPAchar|/hawa/}}, the expected final form; see ''hawa'' below. This form first appears in the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]]. However, likely due to spelling influence or reduplication associations, the earlier {{IPAchar|/fafa/}} resurfaced in the late 16th century towards the end of the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi period]], with both forms seen until recent times, when ''hawa'' falls into disuse.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Initial {{IPAchar|/f-/ [ɸ]}} regularly becomes {{IPAchar|[h]|}}, resulting in modern {{IPAchar|[ha̠ha̠]}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|は|は}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ha̠ha̠]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はは}}

# {{qualifier|humble}} [[mother]]
#* {{RQ:Wamyō Ruijushō|1|116}}
#*: 母 尔雅云、母爲妣、卑履反、去聲之重、和名'''波々'''、日本紀私記云、以路波
#* {{RQ:Nippo Jisho|196}}
#*: '''Fafa'''. l, faua. ハハ. または、ハワ(母) 母.

=====Usage notes=====
Only ever used to refer to one's own mother when speaking to someone else. Still widely used in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}.

#* {{RQ:Man'yōshū|20|4377}}

===Etymology 6===
{{unk.|lang=ja|sort=かか}}. One theory holds that this is a corrupted and abbreviated form of {{ja-l|御方様||okatasama}}, a term to refer to or address someone else's wife (now extremely formal, but much more everyday in the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]]), possibly influenced by children's speech:

{{IPAchar|/okatasama/}} > {{IPAchar|/katasama/}} > {{IPAchar|/kakasama/}} > {{IPAchar|/kaka/}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠ka̠]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かか}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かか|childish}} [[mommy]], [[mummy]]
#* {{RQ:Nippo Jisho|71}}
#*: '''Caca'''. カカ (かか) Faua (母)に同じ. 母. これは子供の言葉である. また、尊敬すべき婦人、あるいは、年長で一家の主婦のような婦人の意に取られる.
# {{lb|ja|sort=かか|obsolete}} [[wife]]
#: Seen in the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]] among the lower socioeconomic classes. Used to refer both to one's own wife when talking to others, and to refer to someone else's wife.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|御母様|おかかさま|okakasama}}: [[mother]]; someone else's [[wife]]
* {{ja-l|お母さん|おっかさん|okkasan}} {{qualifier|formerly one of the most common terms for “[[mother]]”, now considered somewhat archaic}}
* {{ja-l|お母さん|おかあさん|okāsan}} {{qualifier|one of the most common terms for “[[mother]]” in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}}}
* {{ja-l|母様|かかさま|kakasama}}: [[mother]]; someone else's [[wife]] {{qualifier|less formal than ''okakasama''}}
* {{ja-l|母さん|かかさん|kakasan}}: [[mother]] {{qualifier|children's word}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 7===
Alteration of ''kaka''<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>: {{IPAchar|/kaka/}} > {{IPAchar|/-kka/}} > {{IPAchar|/kaː/}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かあ}}

# [[mother]]

=====Usage notes=====
Almost never seen in isolation. Most commonly seen with honorific prefix ''o-'' and honorific suffix ''-san'', as {{ja-l|お母さん||okāsan}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|母さん|かあさん|kāsan}}: [[mother]] {{qualifier|informal form of address; would only be used when addressing one's own mother}}
* {{ja-l|お母|おかあ|okā}}: [[mother]] {{qualifier|informal form of address; would only be used when addressing one's own mother}}
* {{ja-l|お母さん|おかあさん|okāsan}}: [[mother]] {{qualifier|most common term; could be used to address or refer to one's own mother, or to refer to someone else's mother}}
